thread.title: In Denver, Degas the Experimenter

author: Susan Delson
title: In Denver, Degas the Experimenter
text:
He may be renowned for images of classical ballerinas, but as an artist, Edgar Degas was anything but traditional. An energetic experimentalist and innovator, he continually pushed the bounds of his era’s techniques and standards of taste.
That side of the artist is a guiding thread of “Degas: A Passion for Perfection.” Opening Feb. 11 at the Denver Art Museum—its only U.S. venue—the show features more than 100 works across a range of media: paintings, drawings, pastels, etchings, monotype prints and bronze sculptures.
